greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Total digital sum of n: sum of the digital sums of n for all the bases 1 to n (a 'digital sumorial').
comment: Sums of rows of the triangle in A138530. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 26 2008
link: Hieronymus Fischer, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Digit Sum
formula: Asymptotic behavior: a(n) = (1-Pi^2/12)*n^2 + O(n*log(n)) = A004125(n) + A006218(n) + O(n*log(n)).
Recurrence: a(n)=a(n-1)-b(n)+2n-1, where b(n)=sum{1<j,j|n, sum{1<=k<=log_2(j),fract(j^(1/k))=0, j^(1/k)-1}} and fract(x)=fractional part of x=x-floor(x).
a(n) = sum{1<=p<=n, ds_p(n)} where ds_p = digital sum base p.
a(n) = A043306(n) + n (that sequence ignores unary) = A014837(n) + n + 1 (that sequence ignores unary and base n in which n is "10"). - _Alonso del Arte_, Mar 26 2009
mathematica: Table[n + Total@ Map[Total@ IntegerDigits[n, #] &, Range[2, n]], {n, 56}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Jan 03 2017 *)
results.author: _Hieronymus Fischer_, Jul 05 2007, Jul 15 2007, Jan 07 2009
